Hypocenter

core

class SeisMonitor.monitor.locator.hypocenter.core.Hypocenter(catalog: str, xml_path: str, vel_path: str, out_dir: str)[source]

Bases: object

A class for handling hypocenter localization using SEISAN format.

catalog

ObsPy Catalog object containing earthquake events.

Type:

Catalog

xml_path

Path to the station metadata XML file.

Type:

str

vel_path

Path to the velocity model CSV file.

Type:

str

out_dir

Directory where output files will be stored.

Type:

str

out_file

Path to the final relocated earthquake catalog.

Type:

str

paths

Directory for Hypocenter-related intermediate files.

Type:

str

sta0

Path to the STATION0.HYP file used by SEISAN.

Type:

str

locate(sfilename: str = 'catalog.sfile', out_format: str = 'QUAKEML', rm_not_locatable: bool = True) → Catalog[source]

Runs the hypocenter localization process.

Parameters:

  • sfilename (str, optional) – Name of the S-file to be used. Defaults to “catalog.sfile”.

  • out_format (str, optional) – Output format for the relocated catalog. Defaults to “QUAKEML”.

  • rm_not_locatable (bool, optional) – Whether to remove events that cannot be relocated. Defaults to True.

Returns:

The relocated earthquake catalog.

Return type:

Catalog

utils

Hypocenter utils. It runs several seisan commands to get hypocenter solutions

class SeisMonitor.monitor.locator.hypocenter.utils.STATION0(xml_path, vel_path, test={'02': 500.0, '11': 99.0, '13': 1.0, '41': 20000.0, '43': 5.0, '56': 1.0, '85': 0.1}, vsp_ratio={'starting_depth': 2, 'vps': 1.78, 'xfar': 800, 'xnear': 100}, agency='TES', only_vp=True)[source]

SeisMonitor.monitor.locator.hypocenter.utils.check_sfile_integrity(sfile_folder, rm_not_locatable=True)[source]

It checks sfile integrity. We aim that obspy could be read it as catalog.

Parameters:

It is the folderpath where is located all sfiles.

rm_not_locatable: bool

Removes not locatable events

SeisMonitor.monitor.locator.hypocenter.utils.resp2df(resp: str) → DataFrame[source]

Converts a RESP file into a DataFrame containing station metadata.

Parameters:

resp (str) – Path to the RESP file.

Returns:

DataFrame containing station metadata with columns [‘network’, ‘station’, ‘latitude’, ‘longitude’, ‘elevation’].

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

SeisMonitor.monitor.locator.hypocenter.utils.select(sfile_folder)[source]

Parameters:

It is the folder where is located all sfiles.

returns:

It executes select command from SEISAN. select.in: index select.out: Selected information

SeisMonitor.monitor.locator.hypocenter.utils.split(sfile_folder: str, sfilename: str) → None[source]

Splits an S-file into multiple smaller files.

Parameters:

  • sfile_folder (str) – Directory containing the S-file to be split.

  • sfilename (str) – Name of the S-file to be split.

SeisMonitor.monitor.locator.hypocenter.utils.sta2station0(df)[source]

Converts station metadata into SEISAN STATION0 format.

Parameters:

df (pd.DataFrame) – Dataframe with columns [‘network’, ‘station’, ‘latitude’, ‘longitude’, ‘elevation’].

Returns:

List of each message by station. The station message contains the following information:

station lat lon elevation Example: CA01A 353.16N 7341.07W 436

Return type:

list

SeisMonitor.monitor.locator.hypocenter.utils.test2station0(test)[source]

Parameters:

test: dict
key: str

Number of the SEISAN HYPOCENTER test line

value: int

Value of the respective key

Returns:

msgs: list

List of each message by test line.

The test message contains the next information: RESET TEST(key)=value

——example——- RESET TEST(02)=500.0

SeisMonitor.monitor.locator.hypocenter.utils.update(sfile_folder: str) → None[source]

Updates the hypocenter location for each S-file.

Parameters:

sfile_folder (str) – Directory containing the S-files to be updated.

SeisMonitor.monitor.locator.hypocenter.utils.vel2station0(df, only_vp=True)[source]

Parameters:

df: DataFrame

Dataframe with the next columns dep,vp,vs,disc

Returns:

msgs: list

List of each message by discontinuity in the velocity model. The discontinuity message contains the next information:

vp dep vs disc —example— 7.000 25.000 3.940B

Warnings:

Discontinuities B: Conrad N: Moho

SeisMonitor.monitor.locator.hypocenter.utils.vsp_ratio2station0(vsp_ratio)[source]

Parameters:

vsp_ratio: ordered dict

The key order of the dictionary must be the next: “starting_depth”,”xnear”,”xfar”,”vps”

———example——– {“starting_depth”:2, “xnear”:100, “xfar”: 800, “vps”: 1.84},

Returns:

msg: str

Represents the last line of the STATION0 file
